Family Vactions, what can I say but...well there's really nothing to say except for what we did. Where I left off was Detriot, So we saw a tiger's game, WOO HOO! actually, I don't like baseball and didn't like the game, oh well. The next day we hit up the old Henry Ford Museum which was pretty fun, I guess. This time we went to tour the factory and got to see them building trucl which was neat, but would've been reall cool if we'd have not've been there while they were on their lunch break, but...oh well. Anyways, we left there and drove to Fennville, MI, where my mom grew up. We saw the local drug store and grocery store and then went to some hotel in a city a few minutes away. Stayed the night there, ladadadada, and then the next day went back to Fennville and saw my mom's school, and the building where her ward met for church, and one of her old houses and ate at some down-home restaurant where she worked for about a week. That all was...fun? well, one thing was neat about that, we got to see that my mom's long jump record was still unbeaten in her school after 25 years, and we saw her name on a plaque for being the most outstanding female athlete in her graduating class, which both where pretty cool. Then, driving, driving, driving... and finally NAUVOO! Nauvoo was amazing! We stay in like some hotel house thingy which was nice and spent about 2 days walking around the Temple, seeing shows, going through buildings, and just feeling of the spirit that's in that town. It was by far the best part of our vacation. Then, on the 26th, we started for home, but first stopped in Carthage to see the jail where Joseph and Hyrum were martyred. The whole jail had an amazing spirit about it, and especially the room in which the were shot. It was incredible! Afterwards, we set of towards home and I'll spare the details and just give a brief overview: drive, drive drive...too much time spent in Hannibal...drive...stopped in St. Louis & stayed the night>:(...drive, drive, drive, drive, drive, drive, drive, bathroom, drive, drive drive, HUGE ACCIDENT!...drive, drive, whew! HOME AT LAST! WEll, the trip home took a day longer than expected for all the stops, but oh well, I got here! The only bad thing about getting home was that the computer was (unbeknownst to me) out being fixed! So I spent the earlier part of the day cleaning in preparation for company to come tomorrow and friday, and then went to Putt-Putt w/ church, came home and found the COMPUTER, HALLELUIAH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Alrighty, this was my answer to the question posed to me in my profile (so check out the profile b4 you read this) NO WAY! Spoons, OF COURSE, are evolved from sporks which, OF COURSE, are evolved from forks which, OF COURSE, are evolved from chopsticks! I can't even believe somebody would be so ignorant as to not know that. They definitely need to go back to Utensil Evolution 101 b/c evidentially they failed. Or maybe....Maybe it's the teachers' fault. THAT'S IT!!! I mean, look at it this way, I don't remember where I learned that chopstick, OF COURSE, evolved into forks which OF COURSE, evolved into sporks which OF COURSE, evolved into spoons, but I know for a fact we never learned it in Utensil Evolution 101! We just watched movies every class period and TV programs like "The Antiques Roadshow". I mean, What's this world coming too!?! People don't even know about the genealogy of the very tools that help sustain their lives!...Hmmm... *thinkning*...???...DING!*LIGHTBULB* WOW! I know what subject I'm going to teach when I grow up!!! FINALLY! I'll teach Utensil Evolution 101, but I'll actually teach, unlike the "teachers", more like VCR operators, that are destroying the very foundation of our Nation's Educational system! AND, I'm gonna write Bush and ask him what he thinks about this traveshamockery(word taken from the Miller Lite commercial)and what he plans to do about it. If he doesn't do anything, well then I know who I'd vote for if I were old enough vote (oh, and don't get excited Kerry fans out there, b/c I definitely don't mean him). Oh and I'll write my congresswoman too and push for a bill to have a diagram of Utensil Evolution in every Utensil Evolution 101 class in the whole of the United States of A. Maybe I could even design the poster! YEAH! it could look something like this Utensil Evolution Diagram: Chopsticks > Forks > Sporks > Spoons = > --E > -- C E > --O Not bad huh!?! Well, I'd just like to say thank you to the person who posed this question for helping me to realize my calling in life. (Oh and I apologize for calling you "ignorant" before and taking shots at your academic credibility)
